content.raw:
Trying to get my code loaded into CloudSim. Using SSH I got to the log file. Here's a snippet:

```
#!c++

listening on *:4000
about to setup bridge for vpn
f409954b7635afc210fffb11b14dd0d9f15e9b4047c51d91290ed59c4232edef
dockerurl: https://github.com/rmerriam/mystic_src.git
github_deploy_key: undefined
downloading and building team's dockerfile
about to finish setting up bridge for vpn
{"success":true,"operation":"posted event","requester":"rudmerriam@gmail.com"}Tue Jun  6 01:46:53 UTC 2017
deploy complete
::ffff:127.0.0.1 - - [06/Jun/2017:01:46:53 +0000] "POST /events HTTP/1.1" 200 78 "-" "curl/7.47.0"
Tue Jun  6 01:46:53 UTC 2017
executed: /home/ubuntu/code/cloudsim_deploy.bash
Tue Jun  6 01:46:53 UTC 2017
cloud-init is done
```
I'm guessing it didn't access my git hub repository. It's a public repository so shouldn't need a deploy key, right?  Building it locally works fine. Also, building it using SSH into the FC worked.

```
#!c++

docker build -t fcomputer:latest -f docker_mod https://github.com/rmerriam/mystic_src.git

 ...

REPOSITORY          TAG                 IMAGE ID            CREATED             SIZE
fcomputer           latest              74905227c5fb        20 seconds ago      1.799 GB
ros                 indigo-ros-base     43b67f2d9cee        3 days ago          823.9 MB


```
When I hit "Start" it runs but cannot find the ros master. The IP address it reports is correct. The simulation was running with the same IP address. 

Suggestions?

listening on *:4000

I'm guessing it didn't access my git hub repository. It's a public repository so shouldn't need a deploy key, right? Building it locally works fine. Also, building it using SSH into the FC worked.

docker build -t fcomputer:latest -f docker_mod https://github.com/rmerriam/mystic_src.git

When I hit "Start" it runs but cannot find the ros master. The IP address it reports is correct. The simulation was running with the same IP address.
